state_analysis: The terminal indicates that both 'nano' and 'vi' text editors are not available, and attempts to run 'make' have failed due to the absence of a Makefile. The test program also cannot be executed because it does not exist yet, indicating that the project has not been compiled.
explanation: To resolve this, I will create a new Makefile from scratch using echo commands to write the necessary build instructions directly into the Makefile. After that, I will compile the project with the new Makefile and then attempt to run the test program.

commands.keystrokes:
echo 'FC=gfortran
OBJ=my_lib.o test_main.o
all: 
		nmake $(OBJ)
		$(FC) -o test_program $(OBJ)
my_lib.o: my_lib.f90
		$(FC) -c my_lib.f90
test_main.o: test_main.f90
		$(FC) -c test_main.f90
clean:
		rm -f *.o test_program' > src/Makefile
